title: STRY0001: Create Contact Entry Page
iWantTo: Have a page where I can enter a person's contact information
soThat: I can easily and quickly add the contact information for someone I meet
acceptanceCriteria: The blank page has been created in UI Builder under the U&I Conference notes Workspace experience.

title: STRY0002: Create page layout for Contact Entry Page
iWantTo: Have an easy and intuitive user interface and page layout
soThat: I can navigate the page and functions of this application without frustration or hindrances
acceptanceCriteria: Create a page layout that is easy to use, feel free to get as creative as you'd like. You can do as much design or as little design as you want.

title: STRY0003 (version 1): Add Form Component Bundle to the Contact Entry Page
iWantTo: Have a form I can put details in to
soThat: I can grab the contact's information quickly
acceptanceCriteria: The Form Component Bundle and form controller are correctly configured on the page.
hints:
This story and the next are accomplishing the same thing, in two different ways. When working with more than a few fields, we recommend you use the Form Component Bundle - unless there's very specific requirements that can't be met by the Form Component Bundle, a few of which are listed out in the hints section of the next story.

You should only implement one version of STRY0003, and this one is the recommended approach. The other is just for the sake of learning and is more complex than necessary.

title: STRY0003 (version 2): Add fields to the Contact Entry Page (Challenge Mode)
iWantTo: Have a form I can put details in to
soThat: I can grab the contact's information quickly
acceptanceCriteria:
This is the challenge mode version of the story above. It's recommended you use the Form Component Bundle, but if you'd like a challenge then feel free to continue. Make sure to read the Hints panel for both this story and the previous story for full information.
  • The Contact Entry Page includes a "Name" field (string field, required).
  • The Contact Entry Page includes an "Email" field (string field, required, with email format validation).
  • The Contact Entry Page includes a "Note" field (string field, required).
  • The Contact Entry Page includes a "Phone Number" field (string field).
  • The Contact Entry Page includes a "Job Title" field (string field).
  • The Contact Entry Page includes a "Company/Organization" field (string field).
  • The Contact Entry Page includes a "Conference Session Attended" field (string field).
  • The Contact Entry Page includes a "Follow-Up Action" field (string field).
  • The Contact Entry Page includes a "Date/Time Met" field (date/time field).
  • The Contact Entry Page includes a "Tags/Interests" field (string field).
  • The Contact Entry Page includes a "Location Met" field (string field).
  • The Contact Entry Page includes an "Event Role" field (string field).
  • Create a submit button.
  • The form captures input for all specified fields when you click "Submit". You're going to want to use a data resource for this.
  • Data is saved correctly in the ui_conference_notey table upon form submission.
hints:
Generally, you should use the Form Component Bundle except when:
  • You need something super barebones and don't need any of the validation that comes along with the Form Component Bundle.
  • You have very specific styling guidelines or need to make the form look a way that the Out of The Box Form Component Bundle can't look.
  • You're going to do something with the form data that isn't saving it to the database, like an integration or something
If you decide to go this route, make this the COOLEST looking form you've ever seen. Super custom, super stylized, super awesome! Then post it on Linkedin!
You should only implement one version of STRY0003, and this one is just for the sake of learning and is more complex than necessary. Version 1 is the recommended approach.

title: STRY0004: Display Confirmation Message
iWantTo: See a display message upon form submission
soThat: I know the data has been successfully saved
acceptanceCriteria:
• A confirmation message is displayed after form submission.
  • The message confirms that the data has been saved.
hints: You could have this confirmation message pop up in a Modal dialog box. Check those out.

title: STRY0005: Add "Create Another Entry" Button below confirmation message
iWantTo: See "Create another entry" button after the confirmation message
soThat: I can quickly add a new record after saving previous record
acceptanceCriteria:
• A "Create another entry" button appears after the confirmation message.
  • Clicking the button resets the form for a new entry.
hints: This should live inside the modal we created in the last story.

title: STRY0006: L1 menu configuration
iWantTo: Be able to quickly access the Contact Entry Page
soThat: I can quickly create a new contact record
acceptanceCriteria: The L1 menu has a button below the home page button that directs to the Contact Entry Page.
hints: This configuration is done outside of UI builder. Here is an example of it being done for a different workspace that might help you with this: [LINK]

title: STRY0007: Configure the UX list page
iWantTo: Click on a button to see who I haven't reached back out to
soThat: I can quickly see who I need to reach out to
acceptanceCriteria: The UX list page on the workspace displays another list under the "Contact" category, below "all" that shows only users that have the "Reached out to" checkbox unchecked.
hints: This configuration is done outside of UI builder. Here is an example of it being done for a different workspace that might help you with this: [LINK]

title: STRY0008: Configure secondary items for contact record page
iWantTo: Be able to see some more information about the contact record at a glance
soThat: I can have more information handy without needing to scroll through the form
acceptanceCriteria: The following fields are displayed below the contact's name on the contact record page: organization, job title, event name.
hints: The Secondary Items component is in the header of the record page, under the Primary field label. This component gets its configuration from the form controller, but the secondary fields are picked outside of UI builder.

title: STRY0009: Create new "Contact tasks" table
iWantTo: Be able to assign myself tasks to do for each contact
soThat: I can keep track of what I have already done with the contact record
acceptanceCriteria: The contact tasks table should extend the Tasks table.

title: STRY0010: Add contact tasks related list to the contact record page
iWantTo: See a list of contact task records on the records page
soThat: I can see what my next steps are
acceptanceCriteria: The contact tasks table related list should display next to the details tab on the record page.

title: STRY0011: Landing Page configuration
iWantTo: Be able to see what pending tasks I might have at a glance
soThat: I can easily manage all my contacts in this app
acceptanceCriteria:
Configure the landing page to have the following information:
  • Total number of contacts
  • Number of contacts I haven't reached out to yet
  • Number of contacts I am waiting on.
  • Include some reports on number of contact tasks and what state they are in.
hints:
If you want to learn more about Data Visualizations, check out these two academy episodes:
  • Next Experience Academy
  • Platform Analytics Academy

title: STRY0012: Configure Greeting notification
iWantTo: Have an email be sent out to the contact once it's created
soThat: I can share my contact information and other details with the contact I added
acceptanceCriteria: The email includes a thank-you message and the user's contact information.
hints: The notifications table sysevent_email_action is one of the ways you can configure email notifications. Try creating an email notification in there, and check out other records to see how fancy you can make it. You can use placeholders from the record, and do lots of fancy things.

title: STRY0013: Configure Automated Email Flow
iWantTo: Have an automated email that is configurable
soThat: An email is automatically sent to the contact's email address based on settings I configure including my digital contact info.
acceptanceCriteria:
• A flow is triggered upon creating a new contact record that does the following: (Feel free to add more)
  • Send the "Greeting" email to the contact's email address.
  • Create "follow-up" contact task in 1 week to remind the user to check if they received a response to the Greeting email. Add this information to the description of the contact task.
hints: Flow Designer lets you send off an email directly from there by using the "Send email" action, or you can use the "Send notification" action to select and send the notification you created in the previous story. It's good to familiarize yourself with both ways of working.

title: STRY0014: Create Scheduled Job
iWantTo: Be reminded if there are any contact records that I haven't reached out to
soThat: I can make sure to reach out to my contacts in a timely manner
acceptanceCriteria: The scheduled job should run once a month, and should send the user a report with any contacts where "Reached out" to is false.
hints: Scheduled jobs are older technology that you shouldn't really use, but it's important to be familiar with them regardless. Ideally moving forward you would do everything in a Flow, but it's good to familiarize yourself with Scheduled Jobs as it might be an interview question, or you could end up maintaining old Scheduled Jobs at your job.

title: STRY0015: Create "Conference App User" group
iWantTo: Have a group created for this app
soThat: Managing this app's users and roles is easier
acceptanceCriteria: The user group is created.

title: STRY0016: Assign "Conference App User" group the "x_snc_bam_you_i_0.user" role
iWantTo: Assign this role to the group
soThat: I can manage users and roles using best practice
acceptanceCriteria: The user group has the role assigned to it.
hints: Always assign roles to a group and assign users to a group. Never assign roles directly to users.

title: STRY0017: Add Chuck Tomasi to "Conference App User" group
iWantTo: Assign Chuck to this group
soThat: I can learn how to assign users to groups
acceptanceCriteria: Chuck Tomasi user is assigned the Conference App User group.
hints: Something important to note, is that the Chuck Tomasi user is in the sys_user table. There is also an OOB contacts table, but our contacts table is custom for our app. You should almost never need to extend the OOB users table.

title: STRY0018: Create catalog item
iWantTo: Ask for access to this application
soThat: I can track the contact information of people I meet at events
acceptanceCriteria: Catalog item should be created to request access to the "Conference App User" group.
hints: You won't be able to access this through your workspace, and you won't find yourself using it at all, but you should be familiar with creating Catalog Items and this is an example of what they are used for.

title: STRY0019: Create SLA for contact tasks
iWantTo: Be reminded about outstanding contact tasks
soThat: I can make sure to reach out to my contacts in a timely manner
acceptanceCriteria: When a contact task is created, have an SLA generate to remind the user to address the task. Remind the user once it reaches 30 days, 60 days, and 90 days.

title: STRY0020: Create application menu for unified navigation
iWantTo: Provide navigation access for my app's custom tables
soThat: It's easier for me to go in and see the data.
acceptanceCriteria: The application menu should be called "U&I Conference Notes".
hints: Sometimes it feels like everything in ServiceNow is called an "Application". The ones we are referring to in this case are the navigation menu items that you can find under the 'All' menu. They are not created when you create a custom table/app from App Engine Studio, which leaves AES as the only place to easily access your tables.

title: STRY0021: Create application menu item for unified navigation to go directly to contacts table
iWantTo: Provide navigation access for my app's custom tables
soThat: It's easier for me to go in and see the data.
acceptanceCriteria:
Under the "U&I Conference Notes" application menu item, there should be the following:
  • All Contacts
  • All Contact Tasks

title: STRY0022: Format the Phone Number field (server side)
iWantTo: See appropriate formatting for my application's fields
soThat: Everything looks more professional.
acceptanceCriteria: The phone number entered in the field is appropriately formatted to a standard format. (You decide what the format is)
hints:
You can do this in multiple ways, try them out and see which way works best for you.
  • One of the ways to solve this is to teach you how to work with Business Rules. Try figuring out how you can work with Business Rules to format the phone number field once the contact record has been submitted from the form. Bonus points if you learn what RegEx is.
  • Business rules are used to do anything you want to a record as it is saved to the database. They can be executed in multiple ways, learn what they are.
